edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.subsink

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.subsink.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DepthCharge, HeightCharge, Ship, Sub

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
    Entity is the base class for all gameplay entities. It provides mechanisms for motion, interaction, and drawing. All measurements are performed as doubles even though they are pixel-based in order to simplify interactions and fractional motion.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(double x,
              double y,
              double width,
              double height)
        All entities are rectangles, so to initialize one you must provide its position and size.
        Parameters:
        x - The initial x position in pixels
        y - The initial y position in pixels
        width - The initial width in pixels
        height - The initial height in pixels

    • Method Detail

      • interact

        public void interact(Entity other)
        Interact with another entity, by default doing nothing. This will be called with every other entity in the game every single frame. You should override this function to check if the other entity is a kind of entity you know how to deal with, and if so cast it to its appropriate type.

        For checking if two entities are touching, you may want to use Rectangle.intersects(other).

        Parameters:
        other - The entity to interact with

      • update

        public void update(World world,
                   double time)
        Update the entity's state for a single frame, making any necessary changes to the encompassing world. The default implementation just updates position given speed, so you should make a super call if you want motion based on speed.
        Parameters:
        world - The encompassing World
        time - The time since the last update in seconds

      • finalize

        public void finalize(World world)
        Register the disappearance of the entity. You can override this to change the state of the World on the death of the entity.
        Parameters:
        world - The encompassing World

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Mark this entity as destroyed. You should not override this method.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Check if the entity has been destroyed. You should not override this method.

      • paint

        public abstract void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Produce the entiteis's graphics according to its curent state.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context
